about.formula_en:
The TWIST score is calculated by the addition of the selected points:

Variable Points
Testicular swelling No 0
Yes 2
Hard testicle No 0
Yes 2
Absent cremasteric reflex No 0
Yes 1
Nausea/vomiting No 0
Yes 1
High riding testis No 0
Yes 1
about.more_info_en:
Interpretation:

TWIST Score Risk of Testicular Torsion
0-2 Low, no recommendation for ultrasound
3-4 Intermediate, ultrasound indicated
5-7 High, surgical exploration recommended

Validation.text: Barbosa JA, de Freitas PFS, Carvalho SAD, et al. Validation of the TWIST score for testicular torsion in adults. Int Urol Nephrol. 2021;53(1):7-11.
Frohlich LC, Paydar-Darian N, Cilento BG, Lee LK. Prospective validation of clinical score for males presenting with an acute scrotum. Acad Emerg Med. 2017;24(12):1474-1482.
Pan P. Validation of the testicular workup for ischemia and suspected torsion (Twist) score in the diagnosis of testicular torsion in children with acute scrotum. Indian Pediatr. 2020;57(10):926-928.

Manohar CS, Gupta A, Keshavamurthy R, Shivalingaiah M, Sharanbasappa BR, Singh VK. Evaluation of Testicular Workup for Ischemia and Suspected Torsion score in patients presenting with acute scrotum. Urol Ann. 2018;10(1):20-23.

Original/Primary Reference.text: Barbosa JA, Tiseo BC, Barayan GA, et al. Development and initial validation of a scoring system to diagnose testicular torsion in children. J Urol. 2013;189(5):1859-1864.

Other References.text: Qin KR, Qu LG. Diagnosing with a twist: systematic review and meta-analysis of a testicular torsion risk score. J Urol. 2022;208(1):62-70.

creator_info.about_en: João A. Barbosa, MD, is the preceptor physician in the division of urology at the Clinical Hospital of the University of São Paulo in Sāo Paulo, Brazil. He is a member of the European Association of Urology and a scientific advisor to the American Urological Association. Dr. Barbosa’s primary research is focused on urologic oncology and male reproductive health.
